Judul: On Numerical and Experimental Study of Pipe under Low-speed Impact Loads
Abstrak:
Pipelines risk being damaged by impacts and other types of high-speed loading
during operations and installations, for example, onshore pipelines are indented
accidentally by an excavator tooth. In addition, it is very frequent that subsea pipelines
are impacted by anchors, trawl gears and hard objects dropped from the ships. These
demonstrate that accidental loads caused by third party activities have posed a serious
threat to the pipeline integrity, which has been known as main causes of pipeline
accidents. However, this kind of threat is predictable and preventable. The present
study deals with the theoretical, numerical and experimental analyses on the impact
characteristics on the structure of non-pressurized and pressurized line pipe.
The investigations discuss two cases of deformation in which the height of
dropping, dent depth, impact force, internal pressure and geometry of pipe are main
variables. In drop-test simulations, the pipes (Mild Steel and Aluminum) were clamped
and indented by conical and prismatic nose shape indenters alternatively from certain
heights. Occurrence of plastic hinges on the pipe structure was observed during the
process of indentation, which allowed the creation of an important relationship
between the dent depth and external impact force.
Obviously, the analyses have revealed that internal pressure has a significant
influence on the pipe resistance to the deformation subjected to impact loading.
Numerical analysis of these impact studies were carried out by using finite element
code LS-DYNA. The numerical models are able to capture the main trends in an
adequate manner, and excellent agreement between theoretical, experimental and
numerical results has been obtained.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Prof. Ir. I Gusti Nyoman Wiratmaja, Ph.D.
Prof. Ir. Djoko Suharto, M.Sc., Ph.D.
